titleStmt.title: Commonwealth of Kentucky vs. C. G. Bradshaw
CWG8772

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, James F. Robinson: Governor's Official Correspondence File, Petitions for Pardons, Remissions, and Respites, 1862-1863

body.p:
State of Kentucky January Term 1863.
Jefferson Circuit Ct. January 23d 1863

The Commonwealth } Plff
vs } On Indictment
C G Bradshaw (indicted with Lymann Guinnip) } Defts
The defendant being solemnly called to appear in discharge of the recognizance entered into by him, herein in this Court upon the 17th day of November 1862, came not but made default.
It is therefore ordered by the Court that the money deposited in lieu of bail, by said deft, towit Three hundred dollars be paid over to the Trustee of the Jury fund for this County

And on motion of plaintiff a Capias is awarded herein against said defendants returnable &c which Capias shall be endorsed bail of said defendants in the sum of Fifteen hundred dollars with good and sufficient security in a like sum conditioned &c And all further proceedings are continued

A Copy
Attest Jas P Chambers clk
by J R Redding D. C.

Illinois
Commonwealth
vs } Copy Order
C G Bradshaw
Requisition Issd
Apr 18th 1863.
